name: incarnation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a particular life, in religions that believe that we have many lives: previous incarnation He believes that he was a Roman warrior in a previous incarnation. Compare
reincarnation
[ C ] a particular physical form or condition of something or someone that is changing or developing: This film is the latest incarnation of a fairy tale that dates back to the Middle Ages. the incarnation of something
an extreme example, in human form, of a particular characteristic or type of behaviour: He was the incarnation of evil (= was extremely evil).
See more
[ U ] the appearance of a god as a human

God & gods
Add to word list
Add to word list
the human form of a spirit, or the human representation of a principle or idea: [ U ] When he dances, he’s the incarnation of gracefulness.
An incarnation is also, according to some religious beliefs, one of the several lives people have over time.
An incarnation can also be a new or different form or condition of something: [ C ] This movie is the latest incarnation of an old French fairy tale.
